timeline.message: KEYCLOAK-15695 Unify first & max parameters and javadocs

timeline.bodyText: What is the reason for this change? Could the distinct be rather part of the respective SQL statement?
timeline.author: hmlnarik

replies.bodyText: The method used to return a set before streamification so I added distinct(). Looking more into SQL statement and its semantics I don't really see a situation where duplicate groups can occur.
replies.author: martin-kanis

replies.bodyText: Please remove the distinct() to avoid premature realization of the stream.
replies.author: hmlnarik

timeline.bodyText: Rather predefine a private static final Set with the classes and refer to contains method of that one instead.
timeline.author: hmlnarik

timeline.bodyText: I'd rather keep this class as it was.
timeline.author: hmlnarik

replies.bodyText: Reverted
replies.author: martin-kanis

timeline.author: hmlnarik

timeline.bodyText: I'd rather keep this class as is. This is not used often and stream processing here is not beneficial. This applies to dependent classes (like DefaultKeycloakSessionFactory) as well.
timeline.author: hmlnarik

replies.bodyText: Reverted
replies.author: martin-kanis

timeline.bodyText: I'd keep getSpis as was
timeline.author: hmlnarik

replies.bodyText: done
replies.author: martin-kanis

timeline.bodyText: I'd rather keep this file as was
timeline.author: hmlnarik

replies.bodyText: I reverted the getSpis() part. Do you want to revert getProviderFactoriesStream() part as well? Note that the method has 40 usages and most of them look more convenient with Stream variant.
replies.author: martin-kanis

replies.bodyText: You're right, getProviderFactoriesStream() should be kept
replies.author: hmlnarik

timeline.bodyText: Can this be handled via collect() to map instead?
timeline.author: hmlnarik

replies.bodyText: Reverted back to loadSpis().
replies.author: martin-kanis

timeline.bodyText: Can we use PaginationUtils.paginateQuery instead?
timeline.author: vramik

replies.bodyText: I'd say it doesn't provide big benefit because we still need to check and set maxResults to DEFAULT_MAX_RESULTS. See the else clause for details.
replies.author: martin-kanis

replies.bodyText: I added workaround for HHH-14295 to paginateQuery functionso it should be safe to use here. See: 623eb2f#diff-1f7f50ee362cfb68b3f5ff709fc15ab52205fe78a1190642b7ca1db284817185R13-R16
replies.author: mhajas

timeline.bodyText: same here
timeline.author: vramik

timeline.bodyText: I found out the meaning of expanded roles term only from javadoc above. Maybe it'd be worth to rewrite this javadoc to include the info that it returns all roles included composite ones, wdyt?
timeline.author: vramik

replies.bodyText: Done
replies.author: martin-kanis

timeline.bodyText: Ca you please explain this change for me?
timeline.author: vramik

replies.bodyText: I reverted this. I thought it was missing distinct() as the method used to return Set before.
replies.author: martin-kanis

timeline.bodyText: I wonder if we should add a javadoc to all methods from this interface, wdyt?
timeline.author: vramik

replies.bodyText: That would be quite an extensive list of methods :) I would personally leave that for a separate task as it is not related to streamification cleanup but lets see what others think as well.
replies.author: martin-kanis

replies.bodyText: That makes sense, let's create a jira for it and leave this one as is, thank you.
replies.author: vramik

replies.bodyText: For the purpose of the streamification work I would leave those non-documented methods alone. I agree that every method in the SPI should be properly documented but at the same time I think this task warrants its own tracker. So to me this kind of thing falls out of the scope of the streamification work.
replies.author: sguilhen

timeline.bodyText: same here, shouldn't we add javadoc to all?

timeline.bodyText: I'm assuming this is being reverted as well?
timeline.author: sguilhen

replies.bodyText: Yes, this was reverted in the latest commit.
replies.author: martin-kanis

timeline.bodyText: Think we need some consensus on spacing - I usually leave a blank line between the method's description and parameters (much like the javadocs in the Java API classes) while this removes the blank line. The processed javadoc is identical but I wonder if we shouldn't pick one way of doing it and sticking to it.
timeline.author: sguilhen
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -26,17 +26,14 @@
 
     /**
      * Load the SPI definitions themselves.
-     *

timeline.bodyText: I think we again need some consensus on the description of the returned stream. When I documented I used a wording along the lines of "@return a non-null {@link Stream} of realm roles" whereas in this case the fact that the stream can't be null is communicated in a different way. Not a deal breaker for this particular PR, just something we might want to make consistent as part of a follow-up documentation Jira, for example.
timeline.author: sguilhen
